sub_title: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer of the Amazon’s Territory
summary:
I am a self-motivated international development professional with over ten years of experience in working in the academe, government agencies, and multilateral organizations such as UNICEF, UNDP, and UNESCO with international experience in Brazil, France, the Netherlands, and United Kingdom.

Part of my expertise is based on Impact Evaluation and Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) with eight years of evaluating development projects. Identified effective school-based intervention projects for UNDP, Government and NGO`s and monitored its implementation in several municipalities reaching more than 22,000 underprivileged children. 

I am highly-experienced in conducting high-level policy research and analysis and produced the Brazilian Human Development Report in 2010, a result of a point-by-point nationwide consultation giving a voice to over half a million Brazilians. Provided evidence-based information which led to the build-up of the new Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) indicators for the State of Minas Gerais in Brazil. 

In addition to that I am qualified in public and project management as well as proposal writing for local and national governments, besides being skilled in data and knowledge management with experience in handling large datasets (surveys) for UNICEF`s equity-focused evaluation using STATA. Able to author technical research, statistical analyses, and briefings while maintaining high professional and unbiased standards. 

To conclude, I am able to successfully handle stakeholder relations and represent organizations in high-level meetings with authorities and elected officials. Proven experience in serving in an advisory capacity to political figures resulting to significant changes in public policy and reviewing specialised journal articles for the International Review of Administrative Science (SAGE).

I do need to be involved in all phases of this intense exercise by developing an in-depth desktop review based on meetings with government officials, NGO partners and documents; participating in fieldwork visits to gather data and carry out focus group discussions; besides collecting other quantitative data. Furthermore, technical expertise exchange and reporting progress are also part of my duties.', 'title': 'Evaluation Fellow', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3527, 'name': 'Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGjZPHyW5gNxw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856402101?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=VooBL9jV631CqqAQOQes_N7BZJ41A3p1XVtXev7jqn0', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/johns-hopkins-bloomberg-school-of-public-health/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Guinea-Bissau', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health', 'description': 'This was a USAID-funded project in which I had the responsibility to strengthen the capacity of Ministry of Health from Guinea Bissau to continuously monitor community-level SBCC activities (Social and Behaviour Change Communication) by developing a methodology of continuous participatory evaluation in order to influence decision-making.
My deliverables were the following:
•	A concept note for the M&E workshop and implementation phase
•	Situational analysis and research instruments 
•	A developed participatory framework
•	A detailed workshop agenda 
•	A facilitator’s handbook (outlining key concepts to be presented and workshop activities) 
•	Participant workbook
•	A 4-day workshop, conducted
•	A final workshop report with recommendations for sustainability', 'title': 'Evaluation Specialist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 4881, 'name': 'UNICEF', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQE5WFsvU5iicw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856174357?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=wv1Nid09MpsBciWzz6p9fKkTtwXG7NiyQ_Wegdl7y1M', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/unicef/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'São Paulo Area, Brazil', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'UNICEF', 'description': '•	Responsible for gathering and analysing a large dataset containing 140 indicators used for equity-focused interventions with a purpose to provide evidence to influence major policy decisions. These help the organization in advocating on behalf of the well-being of disadvantaged groups.
•	Providing meaningful and essential information to facilitate social policy initiatives such as the signing of the Ministry of Healthcare of a memorandum of understanding (MoU) acknowledging itself as responsible for reducing child mortality rates. 
•	Extracting micro data from the National Household Sample Survey (PNAD) and the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE); Included gender, age, and ethnicity in the datasets to address specific policy needs. 
•	Handling knowledge management tasks which included the creation of datasets and graphics on violence against young people (0 -18 year-olds) in Brazil. The data will be used to the new National Brazilian Report on VIOLENCE AGAINST CHILDREN.
•	The data bring up integral and the latest Brazilian situation with regards to social and economic indicators such as improvement in vaccination coverage and decrease in child labor.', 'title': 'Policy Analyst (National Consultant - short term assignments)', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam', 'description': '• collecting and preparing target variables from secondary data from various sources (World Governance Indicators; Polity 4 project; World Bank Data; CIRI Human Rights Data Project; UNDP; Indices of Social Development; Media Sustainability; Reporters Without Borders; and US-Based Organisation Freedom House);
• Conducting Granger-causality test for a binary regression analysis;
• Conducting cross-country and panel data analysis with endogeneity checks and fixed-effects (country fixed effects, time-lags, and when possible also IV analysis);
• Providing all the raw data, prepared data and STATA log file in a clear and accessible manner', 'title': 'Research Assistant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Brazilian Federal Government', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Brazil', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Brazilian Federal Government', 'description': '•	Manages a budget of USD 5 million annually for education projects, including those targeting children with cognitive difficulties and disabilities. 
•	Interprets financial information and develops financial management mechanisms to minimize financial risk. 
•	Serves in an advisory capacity and provides advice to the President on how to maximize the results of politically sensitive and deadline-driven projects. 
•	Pivotal in evaluating projects during and post-implementation phase. Gathers and documents best practices as reference for future projects. 
•	Formulates long-term business plans for the Ministry of Defense and provides input on improving business performance and reducing operation costs. 
•	Handles end-to-end project management from developing project plans, managing schedules, to identifying project risks and evaluating project outcomes.
•	Leads a team of six staff members and conducts capacity building trainings on planning, organizing, motivating, and controlling resources to achieve specific goals in the context of educational projects. Ensures that all projects are output-oriented and are focused on the quality of education and geared towards optimizing results for the students.
•	Takes charge of stakeholder management and represents the organization in business dealings and meetings with auditors, solicitors and governments. 
•	Liaises with auditors to ensure that annual monitoring is done in a timely manner.', 'title': 'Specialist in Public Management', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1861, 'name': 'UNDP', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFIruBoghVYeQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1593438994352?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=2W_FBE_XoALrKcErJ-be5APZrWLFxSpE-Prdp9V8fHE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/undp/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Brasília Area, Brazil', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'UNDP', 'description': '•	Formulated the methodology used by the Secretaries of the Government of Minas Gerais during the consultations for the negotiations of the new indicators for the MDGs. 
•	Gathered relevant information from key stakeholders which was used to draft the proposal for the new targets and goals which was more comprehensive as it took into consideration the inequalities among municipalities.  The proposal was approved by the Government of Minas Gerais and the UNDP HQ in New York. 
•	Successfully led Minas Gerais to be the first state in the world to rethink the challenges of 2015 and receive commendation from the United Nations as an example to be followed by other states.', 'title': "Negotiation of new MDG's indicators for the State of Minas Gerais (National Consultant)", 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Brazil', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'UNDP', 'description': '•	Conducted data gathering and analysis of secondary data related to the indicators of MDG 7: Ensure environmental sustainability. Concluded by means of factor analysis that it was possible to lessen the number of indicators and make the data more effective as they relate to evidence-based policy advocacy. 
•	Used a multivariate/factorial analysis to correlate indicators and public policies connected to MDG 7 and removed overlapping indicators which resulted to this MDG to be evaluated effectively by decreasing the number of indicators from 46 to eight.
